image.altText: Police tape cordoning off a section of Hindley St, with cars including police vehicles in the background

props.synopsis: Police say a 23-year-old man was found at the scene with life-threatening injuries and died in hospital a short time later.

title.children: Man charged with murder after 23yo allegedly stabbed in Adelaide's CBD

image.altText: Yellow police crime scene tape with a blurred suburban street in the background.

props.synopsis: Police say they believe an Adelaide man was murdered before his house was set on fire to deliberately destroy the evidence.

title.children: SA Police believe man found dead in house fire was murdered

image.altText: Uncle Moogy Sumner AM

props.synopsis: A Ngarrindjeri man's remains which were once traded for a prehistoric tiger skull will finally make their way home this weekend, as one of fourteen First Nations ancestors returned to Australia from United States museums.

title.children: 'Another one of our old people coming back home': Human remains traded for prehistoric animal parts returned to Australia

image.altText: A man with white beard wearing a hat and sunglasses

props.synopsis: A man who groomed and sexually abused a nine-year-old Filipino girl after befriending her mother has been sentenced to 15 years' imprisonment.

title.children: Paedophile handed 15-year sentence for persistent sexual abuse of child overseas

image.altText: A pub and a general store overlooking a river with a pine tree in the middle

props.synopsis: Anger at the closure of popular tourist attractions in the border town of Nelson over the past three years sparks a movement hoping to cut through bureaucracy and create a new plan for the future.

title.children: After years of hard knocks, residents rage against red tape 'quagmire' in bid to save tiny town

image.altText: Close of up young woman with brown curly hair, gazes seriously, wears black leather jacket, white blouse, necklace.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide singer and songwriter won no less than four awards including best new artist, best solo artist, and the most popular pop artist.

title.children: Solo artist Aleksiah wins big at the SA Music Awards as Guy Sebastian is inducted into hall of fame

image.altText: A man in a suit and glasses carrying a bag walks along a sidewalk next to a sandstone-colored building

props.synopsis: Richard Boyle first became an internal whistleblower in 2017, when he became concerned about operations in the tax office.

title.children: Tax office whistleblower Richard Boyle set to stand trial

image.altText: A woman holds an award in a room

props.synopsis: Professor Leah Bromfield, 46, was among those who led the charge for the first National Framework for Protecting Australia's Children in 2007.

title.children: Child protection advocate awarded Australian of the Year for SA

image.altText: A man in a police uniform stands outside a house surrounded by police cars with flashing lights and other officers.

props.synopsis: A police officer found incriminating evidence on a phone. But he was the one charged. So what happened?

title.children: A cop was accused of sharing a suspect's explicit videos. But there was more to the story

image.altText: Wide open windows overlook green trees, with an angular house constructed of red brick and rich wood

props.synopsis: Australia's best-designed new buildings have been lavished with praise at the national architecture awards, including a beach home "rich in detail and delight" as well as the embassy building in Washington.

title.children: Melbourne home, beach house and embassy in US among big winners at national architecture awards

image.altText: Donald trump in a suit with his fist in the air

props.synopsis: The US Department of Justice says it has charged 51-year-old Farhad Shakeri, alleging Iranian authorities had tasked him with preparing hits on Israeli and American citizens, including the president-elect.

title.children: Man charged over alleged Iranian plot to assassinate Donald Trump

image.altText: Donald Trump gestures a distance between his two hands

props.synopsis: Australia's election campaign will not be fought in the way the US race was fought: as a battle between rage or joy. But we should despair that it will feature little of the policy rigour or ambition that economists like Geoff Carmody brought to battles gone by.

title.children: Americans may feel their government services have let them down. But Trump has no solid policy solutions to the problems

image.altText: Emergency services at Sydney Airport after engine failure forced a Qantas flight to make emergency landing

props.synopsis: Just as QF520's wheels left the tarmac, passengers heard a "loud bang" with Qantas later confirming the plane experienced a "contained engine failure".

title.children: Qantas engine failure at Sydney Airport is now subject to urgent investigations. This is what we know

image.altText: Four men hold beers while smiling at the camera for a selfie while sitting in a stadium

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken to Israelis who say they were attacked by people who asked if they were Jewish in Amsterdam after a match between Maccabi Tel Aviv and Ajax.

title.children: 'Anti-Semitic hit-and-run squad' attacks leaves Israeli soccer fans scrambling to leave Amsterdam, vowing to never return

image.altText: A man with a silver beard wearing a red cap that reads: 'Jesus is my savior, Trump is my president'

props.synopsis: As we crunch data and pore over the exit polls to try to get an understanding of the way America voted, along with the economy and immigration, religion must also be understood as a decisive factor delivering victory to the Republicans.

title.children: The power of God, the power of the presidency: How religion helped Trump win

image.altText: Australian dollar notes and Chinese Yuan.

props.synopsis: Stella says she had no idea she was involved in an international money laundering operation until a text message from China warned her bank account there had been frozen.

title.children: International students tricked into becoming money laundering 'mules' for scammers

image.altText: A woman holds up a sign showing a tombstone with the words "Roe 1973-2022".

props.synopsis: Abortion and reproductive rights have been a divisive issue in the United States since Roe v Wade was overturned by the Supreme Court in 2022 and figured heavily in the election campaign.

title.children: Abortion rights were also on the agenda in the US election. Here's what happened

image.altText: Mary Senuta wears a black 'Trump' cap while standing at a bar in a function room.

props.synopsis: If you've ever seen a Trump rally and paid attention to the crowd behind him, you might think you know what his typical voter looks like. Spend some time in swing state Pennsylvania, and your impressions might change.

title.children: What Pennsylvania taught me about Trump voters

image.altText: John Bingham, dressed in a suit sits on a bed behind his future wife in a dress and sweater.

props.synopsis: Wealthy aristocrat Lord Lucan was accused of killing his nanny and attacking his wife inside his London home. But after half a century of speculation about his whereabouts, his female victims have been forgotten.

title.children: How a British aristocrat accused of murdering his children's nanny vanished into thin air

image.altText: Beyonce smiles and waves.

props.synopsis: Her album 'Cowboy Carter' picked up an Album of the Year nomination. Taylor Swift and Sabrina Carpenter, Charli XCX Kendrick Lamar, Post Malone and Chappell Roan also scored nominations, as did Aussies Tame Impala and Troye Sivan.

title.children: Beyoncé leads Grammy nominations, becomes most nominated artist in history

image.altText: A cute native bee with vivid blue bands on its back.

props.synopsis: The moth or the butterfly? The stick insect or the hoverfly? The beetle or the bee? Can you guess which is the inaugural ABC Australian Insect of the Year?

title.children: 'Cute and an attractive' pollinator, crucial for food crops is the 2024 ABC Australian Insect of the Year

image.altText: Nic White kneels with England players behind him

props.synopsis: The Wallabies are at a crucial juncture, arguably the most crucial moment in the history of the code in Australia. A massive 2025 starts with this grand slam tour.

title.children: The ultimate test facing the Wallabies ahead of a defining 2025

image.altText: man in navy in wheelchair  shirt speaks to press

props.synopsis: Two survivors of a bombing that killed 22 people at the close of an Ariana Grande concert seven years ago have been awarded £45,000 ($AU88,000) in damages after successfully suing a conspiracy theorist who claimed the attack was staged.

title.children: Manchester bombing survivors awarded thousands in damages after harassment by conspiracy theorist

image.altText: The fictional Saturday Night Live cast for 2024 film Saturday Night.

props.synopsis: The director of Saturday Night tells us how he wanted the film to capture the wild "antics" of the show, and pay homage to a generation of comics that came before him.

title.children: 'TV had become very stale': When Saturday Night Live first premiered, it was something totally new

image.altText: A sticker saying ABORTION ACCESS IS A COMMUNITY RESPONSIBILITY over a heart, stuck on a blue sign

props.synopsis: A public hospital in regional New South Wales is restoring abortion services after an ABC investigation revealed the executive had banned staff from providing terminations to patients for non-medical reasons.

title.children: NSW Health Minister says abortion services at Orange Hospital will be restored after executive restricted access

image.altText: An eroded plaster body of a human sits on a table in front of a red and white fresco

props.synopsis: An international study has found assumptions on the sex and relationships of individuals found in the ruins of the ancient Roman city buried in a volcanic eruption were not based on scientific evidence.

title.children: DNA testing reveals Pompeii residents weren't who they were thought to be

image.altText: A close up photo of a man with an eyepatch covering one eye.

props.synopsis: The book, which was so controversial it forced the Indian-born author into hiding for six years, may be legally imported into India after a High Court ruling.

title.children: India's three-decade ban of Salman Rushdie 'Satanic Verses' quashed on a technicality

image.altText: Mark Willacy wearing glasses and a black shirt

props.synopsis: ABC journalist Mark Willacy describes the unexpected moment when the Sydney to Brisbane Qantas flight QF520 was forced to make an emergency landing.

title.children: ABC journalist reveals moment his blood ran cold during Qantas take-off emergency

image.altText: An elephant stands in a pen with a yellow hose above her head.

props.synopsis: Elephants in the Berlin Zoo were captured on video using a sophisticated tool — a hose — to take a shower and prank each other.

title.children: Why shower with your nose when you can use a hose? Zoo elephants adopt garden tech

image.altText: A penguin on scales.

props.synopsis: After washing up in Denmark on the southern coast of Australia after a 3,400km trip the penguin, given the name Gus, is being looked after by wildlife carers.

title.children: Lost emperor penguin recovering after record journey across Southern Ocean

image.altText: In the foreground, a child on their parent's back. In the background, a crowd. A giant plume of smoke rises above them

props.synopsis: Indonesia's Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano erupted several times on Friday following an eruption on Sunday night that killed nine people.

title.children: A towering column of ash threatens thousands in Indonesia amid a week of volcanic eruptions

image.altText: An example of a brochure

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of Australians were allegedly misled by promotions offered by direct mail order catalogue Magnamail, some of whom were elderly or vulnerable, according to Australia's consumer watchdog.

title.children: ACCC sues over Magnamail's false 'prize' promotions, alleging it misled the 'vulnerable and elderly'

image.altText: Liam Payne leads into microphone

props.synopsis: Three people have been charged in One Direction Singer Liam Payne's death

title.children: Three charged in relation to death of One Direction singer Liam Payne

image.altText: a huge crocodile in a small pond

props.synopsis: We've only got two US election questions this week, hope you paid attention to the rest of the news.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A giant crocodile, the Melbourne Cup, and a little bit of Trump
